quest.name: Kurobana vs. the Arrowheads
journal: Fukudo has thought long and hard about this.

Fukudo states that he thinks Kurobana might be suited to plucking weeds from paddy fields. He also explains that “Namai” is actually a local term for the arrowhead: an aquatic plant often found in paddies. You accompany Kurobana to go and talk with Hayabusa, a friend of Fukudo's, and ask if he will let you clear his paddy fields of weeds.

Hayabusa is delighted by the offer of help and quickly assigns you and Kurobana areas to work on. While the original plan was for only Kurobana to tend the paddies, you are convinced to join him as it is a good chance to experience the local culture. Dusting off your hands, you prepare to rip out some weeds.

Hayabusa praises both you and Kurobana for a job well done. However, just as Kurobana is starting to believe he may have finally found a way to contribute to Namai, he mentions that Hayabusa's paddies smelled somewhat odd. The rice farmer takes great offense at this remark, making it clear that he would like Kurobana to leave immediately.
Fukudo will likely be disappointed once he learns that Kurobana has failed to succeed, despite being able to handle the work itself.
Kurobana reiterates that he meant no harm and that Hayabusa's paddies genuinely gave off a strange smell. Fukudo accepts that Kurobana bore no ill will and says he will apologize on the boy's behalf.

dialogue.name: FUKUDO
dialogue.text: I have come to the conclusion that Kurobana might be best suited to plucking weeds from the paddy fields.

dialogue.name: FUKUDO
dialogue.text: Our village name is actually a local term for the arrowhead, an aquatic plant that infests paddy fields if not kept under control.

dialogue.name: FUKUDO
dialogue.text: This is precisely why removing weeds is such an important part of rice farming. I do hope you are up to this task, Kurobana. If you fail this time, do not expect to have another chance to prove yourself.

dialogue.name: FUKUDO
dialogue.text: I trust you understand the importance of this task?

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: Do not worry, Fukudo. Weed plucking actually sounds quite nice! I have always enjoyed little odd jobs like that.

dialogue.name: FUKUDO
dialogue.text: I recall Hayabusa mentioning he was looking for help tending to his paddy fields. Ask if he will allow you to remove the weeds from his paddies.

dialogue.name: FUKUDO
dialogue.text: Forename, please accompany him and make sure that he does as I have asked.

dialogue.name: FUKUDO
dialogue.text: Forename, please accompany Kurobana and make sure he does as I have asked.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: I have always enjoyed little odd jobs like plucking weeds.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: I will not fail this time. I cannot.

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: Ah, you must be the adventurer I have heard so much about. And Kurobana, nice to see you well. Is there something you would ask of me?

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: How kind of you to offer!

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: You can never be too careful with those pesky arrowheads.

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: Be sure to take care not to trample any of the rice plants when you are removing the weeds.

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: Why don't you help Kurobana with the work, adventurer? Not many travelers have the chance to experience such a core part of life in Namai.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Of course I'll help! I've done this before.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You grasp the weed's stem before pulling, right?

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: This is truly not your first time? Very impressive.

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: Precisely! Do not simply remove the top of the weed─you must remove the roots as well.

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: Well, there is nothing more for me to tell you both. Please work the paddies on top of this hill for me.

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: Well, there is nothing more for me to tell you both. Please work the paddies on top of this hill for me.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: I think this may be the job for me, Forename! Just watch, these paddies will be free of weeds by the time I am done.

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: Finished already?

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: Fine work indeed! I see you made sure to remove the entire weed, including its roots.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: I also had Hayabusa check my work and it seems like I have finally found a job I can do.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: However, something did bother me a bit while I was working. It could be my imagination, but do these paddies not smell a little...odd?

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: Odd!? Is your nose quite all right? I tend to these fields daily and have never smelled anything strange.

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: Honestly, I cannot fathom how you think it acceptable to criticize my paddies when I have allowed you to work them. Do you make fun of people's children when you are a guest in their homes!?

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: Or are you merely moaning because you had to engage in hard labor? Frankly, it matters not. Be gone with you!

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: I─I am sorry! I did not mean it as an insult.

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: Thank you for all you have taught me, Hayabusa. I will leave you at once. Come along, Forename, let us go speak with Fukudo.

dialogue.name: HAYABUSA
dialogue.text: I have never smelled anything remotely strange in all my years tending these paddies!

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: I was not trying to insult Hayabusa. They did smell different to other paddy fields.

dialogue.name: FUKUDO
dialogue.text: Tell me, have we at last found the right job for you?

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: Well...yes and no.

dialogue.name: FUKUDO
dialogue.text: So you are telling me that whilst the job went well, you managed to accidentally offend Hayabusa with a careless remark?

dialogue.name: FUKUDO
dialogue.text: Would you care to explain why you could not just keep quiet?

dialogue.name: KUROBANA
dialogue.text: (-Kurobana-)It was not my intention to upset him. I was simply surprised by the smell of the paddy fields...

dialogue.name: FUKUDO
dialogue.text: Never mind. Hayabusa is a reasonable gentleman; I am sure he only reacted how he did because of how much effort he puts into his work. I will go and speak with him myself.
